docs.summary: Images are images stored in the Media Manager or retrieved from an external web location.
description: The URL formats for images are:
+ Images from the Media Manager: `wix:image://v1/<uri>/<filename>#originWidth=<width>&originHeight=<height>[&watermark=<watermark_manifest_string>]`
+ Images from the web: `http(s)://<image url>`

docs.summary: Sets or gets an image's alt text.
description: An image's alternative text is typically a relatively short phrase that
describes what the image depicts.
The alternative text is used:
+ If the browser cannot display the image.
+ If the user is utilizing a screen reader.
+ By search engines to understand what images are on your site.

docs.summary: Sets or gets the action that occurs when an image is clicked.
description: Setting the `clickAction` property sets what happens when
an image is clicked.
The value can be set to:
+ `"none"`: Nothing happens.
+ `"expand"`: The image opens in a popup window
+ `"link"`: The image's [`link`](#link) opens.
+ `"magnified"`: The cursor becomes a magnifying glass when a visitor hovers over the image.
Getting the `clickAction` property returns what happens when
an image is clicked.

examples.title: Get the action that occurs when an image is clicked
Set the action that occurs when an image is clicked

docs.summary: Sets or gets how an image is placed inside an image element.
description: Setting the `fitMode` property sets what happens when an image element
contains an image with dimensions that do not match the dimensions
of the element as set in the Editor.
The value can be set to one of `"fill"`, `"fit"`, or `"fixedWidth"`.
The descriptions below contain sample scenarios that place the following images
into an image element, where the size of the image element is 100x100.
![fitMode example images](images/fitMode_images.png "fitMode example images")
+ `"fill"`: Fills the entire image element. The image is resized (meaning
enlarged or reduced), maintaining its original aspect ratio, so that there
is no empty area in the image element. When an image is resized, the center
of the original image is shown in the image element and the part of the original
image that does not fit into the image element is not shown.
![fitMode fill example images](images/fitMode-fill.png "fitMode fill example images")
+ `"fit"`: Fits the entire image in the image element. If the image is reduced,
the image is centered in the image element and any empty space is filled in
with the image element's border color and opacity.
![fitMode fit example images](images/fitMode-fit.png "fitMode fit example images")
+ `"fixedWidth"`: The image element's width remains fixed and the image is enlarged
or reduced, maintaining its original aspect ratio, so that it fits the image
element's width. The image element's height is adjusted accordingly.
![fitMode fixed width example images](images/fitMode-fixedWidth.png "fitMode fixed width example images")
Getting the `fitMode` property returns the current fit mode.

docs.summary: Sets or gets the file location of the image.
description: Setting the `src` property changes the displayed image to
the image found at the new `src` value.
Getting the `src` property returns the location of the
current image file.
The image file can either be an image file from the Media Manager
or an external file from any web location.
The URL formats supported are:
+ Images from the Media Manager: `wix:image://v1/<uri>/<filename>#originWidth=<width>&originHeight=<height>[&watermark=<watermark_manifest_string>]`
+ Images from the web: `http(s)://<image url>`

examples.title: Set the image to be an image from the Media Manager
Set the image to be an image from the web

docs.summary: Sets or gets an image's tooltip.
description: An image's tooltip text is displayed when a user hovers over the image
or when the image opens in a popup.

relatedContent.text: How to Add Custom Interactions with JavaScript

FAQs.title: What URL format do I use for images?
FAQs.markdown:
You can use images on your site that are stored in the [Wix Media Manager](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-the-media-manager), or use images retrieved from an external web location.

The URL formats for images are as follows:

*   **Images from the Media Manager:** `wix:image://v1/<uri>/<filename>#originWidth=<width>&originHeight=<height>[&watermark=<watermark_manifest_string>]`
*   **Images from the web: `**http(s)://<image url>

FAQs.title: Which image file types are supported?
FAQs.markdown:
Wix supports the following image file types: .jpg, .png, and .gif. 

Flash files (.SWF) are also supported, but they must be added to your site using the [Flash element](https://support.wix.com/en/article/adding-flash).

FAQs.title: Can I set my images to be clickable?
FAQs.markdown:
Yes. Use the [`clickAction`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Image.html#clickAction) property to set what happens when a site visitor clicks an image. The following actions are available when an image is clicked:

*   Open the image in a popup window
*   Open a link
*   Let the visitor zoom in and out of the image (magnify)

You can also disable [`clickAction`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Image.html#clickAction) by setting it to `none` and add a regular [`onClick`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Image.html#onClick) event handler to the image.
